item.title: By: Joseph Scott’s Blog » Google Blog Search
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott’s Blog » Google Blog Search
item.description: [...] This is the day that everyone saw coming, Google announced their new service: Google Blog Search. There is plenty of commentary on this already, so I’ll try to keep my comments simple and to the point. It may be helpful to read my complaints on feed search from August 2004. [...]
item.content:encoded: […] This is the day that everyone saw coming, Google announced their new service: Google Blog Search. There is plenty of commentary on this already, so I’ll try to keep my comments simple and to the point. It may be helpful to read my complaints on feed search from August 2004. […]

item.title: By: Thorvald Kik
item.dc:creator: Thorvald Kik
item.description:
Great post!
Seems i found my destination here! I'm currently working on the feed search engine <a href="http://www.plazoo.com"/ rel="nofollow">plazoo.com</a>, which was not out when you wrote this article. Still, we miss some functionality you mentioned but we work hard to catch up and we got some nice stuff in work that you really will like i think.
Best regards,
Thorvald Kik
item.content:encoded:
Great post!

Seems i found my destination here! I’m currently working on the feed search engine plazoo.com, which was not out when you wrote this article.
Still, we miss some functionality you mentioned but we work hard to catch up and we got some nice stuff in work that you really will like i think.

Best regards,

Thorvald Kik

item.title: By: Topix.net Weblog
item.dc:creator: Topix.net Weblog
item.description: <strong>The Daily Internet</strong> Jeremy Zawodny expands on a review of feed search engines: Why Hasn't Anyone Figured Out How To Do Feed Searches? The kind of searches I regularly do on Feedster and Technorati just aren't available on Google. No amount of fiddling...
item.content:encoded:
The Daily Internet
Jeremy Zawodny expands on a review of feed search engines: Why Hasn’t Anyone Figured Out How To Do Feed Searches? The kind of searches I regularly do on Feedster and Technorati just aren’t available on Google. No amount of fiddling…

item.title: By: Michael Fioritto's Weblog
item.dc:creator: Michael Fioritto's Weblog
item.description: <strong>Jeremy Zawodny: Feed Search vs. Web Search</strong> The current state of "feed search" is messy at best. Joseph Scott does a good job of presenting his impressions on the major feed search engines (where "feed" means RSS/Atom): Say I wanted to track what people are saying about PostgreSQL. This can&...
item.content:encoded:
Jeremy Zawodny: Feed Search vs. Web Search
The current state of “feed search” is messy at best. Joseph Scott does a good job of presenting his impressions on the major feed search engines (where “feed” means RSS/Atom): Say I wanted to track what people are saying about PostgreSQL. This can&…
